pageTitle: Gold Seeker Closing Report: Gold and Silver Gain Again
textBeforeTable: The Economy:   Gold posts positive returns in Q2 2011, while commodities suffer major price correction  World Gold Council   Gold and silver equities traded about 1% higher in the first hour of trade, but they then turned almost 1% lower by midday and remained near that level for the rest of the day.   Euro gold climbed to a new record high above 1122, platinum gained $8.50 to $1762.50, and copper fell a couple of cents to about $4.37.
textAfterTable: Tomorrow at 8:30AM EST brings CPI for June expected at -0.1%, Core CPI expected at 0.2%, and Empire Manufacturing for July expected at 1.0.  At 9:15 is Industrial Production for June expected at 0.2% and Capacity Utilization expected at 76.8%, and at 9:55 is Michigan Sentiment for July expected at 71.4.   The Markets:   Charts Courtesy of http://finance.yahoo.com/   Oil fell as the U.S. dollar index pared early losses
